a.title: Must be signed into Google with your 4J account to access this site
Contractor Chosen to Build New North Eugene High School

h2.a: Contractor Chosen to Build New North Eugene High School

em.strong: Long established firm with local experience will serve as CM/GC

div.p: Planning for the new North Eugene High School is underway. A construction manager/general contractor (CM/GC) has been selected to coordinate planning and construction of the new building: Lease Crutcher Lewis (Lewis), a construction company with offices in Eugene, Portland and Seattle, founded in 1886.

Lewis’s numerous high-profile local projects have included PK Park, the Lillis Business Complex, Erb Memorial Union and other buildings at the University of Oregon, the LCC Downtown Campus and Titan Court, the Center Building and other buildings at the Lane Community College main campus, and the EWEB operations building, as well as high schools and other buildings in the Portland and Seattle areas.

Lewis’s proposal was ranked highest by the selection committee that reviewed the proposals from several firms and interviewed top candidates. Contract negotiations were completed successfully and the school board voted in April to approve the selection and award the contract to the selected CM/GC team.

CM/GCs are brought on early in the design process so that the firm can work with the architects and the district to analyze building systems, provide cost estimates, develop construction schedules, plan for the anticipated months of construction, and help ensure that the school replacement projects will be completed on time and within budget.

The district, the architect team, and the selected construction firm will work as a team throughout the design and construction process of the new North Eugene High School. Subcontractors will be selected through a publicly advertised, competitive solicitation process.

Two other school buildings also will be replaced and one will be expanded thanks to voters’ approval of the 2018 school bond measure. The CM/GC for the new Edison Elementary School is local firm John Hyland Construction. Architects and contractors for the expansion of Gilham Elementary School will be selected this spring, and the team for Camas Ridge Elementary School, the last of the three schools to be constructed, will be selected in the fall.

a.title: Contractor Chosen to Build New North Eugene High School

a.title: The interdistrict transfer application period has been extended by one month to ensure all families have the opportunity to apply for a transfer, despite school buildings being closed statewide due to the coronavirus COVID-19 pandemic. The deadline for applications to be included in the annual interdistrict transfer lottery is now April 30, 2020. [ https://www.4j.lane.edu/instruction/enrollment/outofdistricttransfers/ | https://www.4j.lane.edu/instruction/enrollment/outofdistricttransfers/﻿ ]

article.class: odd alt inprogress allday confirmed cal0 vevent event

a.title: There’s no better time to show appreciation for a deserving 4J teacher, staff member, administrator or volunteer with an ACE Awards nomination. And now there's more time to do just that! Due to the coronavirus pandemic and extended closure of school buildings, the nomination deadline has been extended a month to April 30 . [ https://forms.gle/HddyfefTXGMJBd7Y7 | Submit a Nomination ] by April 30 (tinyurl.com/4JACE2020) Nominating a valued co­-worker, supervisor, or volunteer for the ACE Awards is a wonderful way to honor their talent and dedication, including now as the 4J community is working so hard under challenging circumstances to keep students learning away from the classroom. The district is accepting nominations for the ACE (A Champion in Education) Awards in four categories: teachers and licensed specialists, administrators and supervisors, classified staff, and volunteers. There is no limit to the number of people you can nominate or the number of times a person can be nominated. One nominee in each category will be named an ACE Award Champion. One nominee also may be recognized with a special lifetime achievement award. Each winner will receive a $250 grant for a 4J school or program of their choosing from the Eugene Education Foundation. Whether the circumstances allow for a group celebration or not, all 2020 ACE award nominees and champions will be acknowledged and celebrated. Past nominees and champions: [ https://www.4j.lane.edu/2019/05/education-champions-named-in-2019-ace-awards/ | 2019 ] , [ https://www.4j.lane.edu/2018/05/education-champions-named-in-2018-ace-awards/ | 2018 ] , [ http://www.4j.lane.edu/2017/04/2017-ace-awards-champions/ | 2017 ] , [ http://www.4j.lane.edu/2016/04/2016-ace-awards-champions/ | 2016 ]

span.a: 4J ACE Awards: Nominate a Champion (deadline extended)

The closure has now been extended through the end of the school year . a.title: You can find the meeting agenda at [ https://v3.boardbook.org/Public/PublicHome.aspx?ak=1000666 | tinyurl.com/4jboardbook ] The board will convene in executive session “to consider the employment of a public officer, employee, staff member or individual agent,” pursuant to ORS 192.660 (2) (a). All matters discussed during this executive session are confidential and shall not be disclosed by any representative of the news media without authorization by the school board.

span.a: Eugene School Board Meeting - Executive Session (non public)

a.title: About the budget committee: [ https://www.4j.lane.edu/board/budgetcommittee/ | https://www.4j.lane.edu/board/budgetcommittee/ ] Meeting agendas and other information: [ https://v3.boardbook.org/Public/PublicHome.aspx?ak=1000666 | https://v3.boardbook.org/Public/PublicHome.aspx?ak=1000666 ] EUGENE SCHOOL DISTRICT 4J, LANE COUNTY, OREGON NOTICE OF BUDGET COMMITTEE MEETING Two public meetings of the Budget Committee of Eugene School District 4J, Lane County, State of Oregon, to discuss the budget for the fiscal year July 1, 2020 to June 30, 2021, will be held in the months of April 2020 and May 2020. The first meeting will be held on April 27, 2020, at 6:00 p.m. The purpose of the meeting is to receive the budget message and to receive comment from the public on the budget. The second meeting will be held on May 11, 2020, at 6:00 pm for approval of the budget. In light of current public health concerns related to coronavirus COVID-19, both meetings of the Eugene School District Budget Committee will take place virtually. Budget Committee members will meet by phone pursuant to ORS 294.426, and the meetings will be open to the public via live broadcast on KRVM 1280-AM and via the internet at www.4j.lane.edu/stream. This is a public meeting where deliberation of the Budget Committee will take place. Any person may comment on the budget. NOTICE: Public comment will be received via email only. In an effort to reduce the spread of coronavirus COVID-19 and in compliance with the Governor's Stay Home, Save Lives Executive Order, these meetings will be held virtually and there will not be in-person public comment. Send public comment via email to budget_comm@4j.lane.edu * Clearly label the subject line as: "Public Comment" * or mail to 4J Budget Committee – Public Comment, 200 North Monroe St., Eugene, OR 97402. Public comment received by 6:15 pm on the day of each meeting will be read during the public comment portion of the agenda, in order of receipt, and published with committee materials on the District’s website (https://v3.boardbook.org/Public/PublicHome.aspx?ak=1000666 ). The budget committee will read, review and consider all public comment. A copy of the budget document may be inspected online at http://www.4j.lane.edu/finance/docs/ or obtained by mail on or after April 14, 2020, via email request to budget_comm@4j.lane.edu or phone request via phone message to 541- 790-7627. Andrea Belz Budget Officer

span.a: Regular Meeting of the Budget Committee (Virtual)
